business.headline: Sensex ends over 500 points lower, Nifty below 25,000; Axis Bank falls 5%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 501.51 points to 81,757.73 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 143.05 points lower at 24,968.40. Most of the broader market indices also reflected the weak sentiments on Dalal Street.

2025 tech layoffs: Amazon, Microsoft, Google fuel job fears amid AI pushThe year 2025 was supposed to be a new chapter. A time when artificial intelligence promised smarter work, faster growth, and a better future. But for tens of thousands of workers across the world, it has meant sleepless nights, and uncertain futures.

Axis Bank shares tank 7% today. Should you sell or hold the stock?Axis Bank shares: The stock has been on a downward trend in recent times. It has fallen 5.77% in the last five days, 9.14% in the past one month, and 15.27% over the last year.

Reliance Retail acquires Kelvinator to expand appliance businessReliance believes this move will help it grow faster in the consumer durables sector, connect more closely with customers, and open up bigger long-term opportunities in India's changing market.

Explained: Why Wipro shares gained as much as 4% todayThe fourth-largest IT services company in India posted an 11% jump in net profit and a 0.8% rise in revenue—both slightly ahead of market expectations, according to estimates compiled by LSEG.

Stocks, FD or MF? Edelweiss' Radhika Gupta shares 3 golden rules before you investBefore you begin investing, know how saving and investing are different. Saving keeps your money handy for emergencies or short-term plans, while investing helps it grow for bigger future goals.

Sensex tumbles over 600 points: Why is stock market falling today?The 30-share BSE Sensex tumbled 644.99 points to 81,614.25 around 12:19 pm, while the NSE Nifty 50 fell 191.30 points to 24,920.15. Losses were broad-based, with most of the major sectoral indices in the red.

ITR-2 online filing live: Know who can file, new changes and other detailsThis year, the ITR-2 form has a few important changes that every taxpayer should know. You now have to report your long-term capital gains separately for periods before and after July 23, 2024, as new indexation and tax rules apply.

The ULIP trap: Inside India's most mis-sold financial productPart one of our story explores why ULIPs remain among the most mis-sold financial products in India. Sold as all-in-one solutions, they often fail to deliver on either insurance or investment.

Who is Astronomer CEO Andy Byron, caught on Coldplay's kiss camAndy Byron, the CEO of data-driven startup Astronomer was caught on the Coldplay concert's kiss cam with a colleague, and the clip has went viral online.

Startup founder calls flight travel insurance a scam, shares experienceWhat should have been a straightforward process turned into a weeks-long battle across multiple platforms and customer service calls.
Sensex opens 100 points lower, Nifty below 25,100; Wipro jumps 3%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 199 points to 82,060.24, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 40.50 points to 25,070.95, as of 9:28 am.

entertainment.headline: Jurassic World Rebirth: Scarlett Johansson's dino saga crosses Rs 100 crore in India'Jurassic World: Rebirth' hit Rs 100 crore in India, becoming the second highest-grossing Hollywood film in the country in 2025. The film, starring Scarlett Johansson and Jonathan Bailey, released in theatres on July 4.

Rajkummar Rao and Patralekhaa enjoy dreamy babymoon in New Zealand, share picsRajkummar Rao and Patralekhaa are expecting their first child and recently enjoyed a romantic babymoon in New Zealand. Their dreamy vacation photos, including a sweet poolside kiss, have gone viral on social media.

Tillotama Shome's Baksho Bondi to open Indian Film Festival of Melbourne 2025Tillotama Shome's Bengali film 'Baksho Bondi' will be the opening movie at the Indian Film Festival of Melbourne 2025 on August 14. The film is about the silent strength of working women and was earlier shown at the Berlin Film Festival.

Did you know singer Shashwat Singh is Permanent Roommates' actor Nidhi's brother?Singer Shashwat Singh discussed his artistic journey and the strong sibling bond with actor Nidhi Singh. He credited his family's unwavering support for his success in the music industry.

Jimmy Kimmel extends support to Stephen Colbert as CBS cancels The Late ShowJimmy Kimmel expressed strong support for Stephen Colbert after CBS announced the end of 'The Late Show with Stephen Colbert'. CBS citied financial reasons despite the show's recent Emmy nomination.

Saiyaara review: Ahaan Panday's starry debut for hearts that loved, lost and healedRelease Date:Fri Jul 18, 2025Saiyaara movie review: With Ahaan Panday making a starry, emotionally grounded debut, 'Saiyaara' becomes a soft place for bruised hearts to land, especially for today's generation. It's a reminder that perhaps both heartbreak and healing can be beautiful.

Kothapallilo Okappudu review: Ambitious attempt stumbles despite thoughtful themesRelease Date:Fri Jul 18, 2025Kothapallilo Okappudu movie review: Director Praveena Paruchuri's 'Kothapallilo Okappudu' is a thought-provoking film on faith and belief. While there's a lot to ponder, the film goes through a bumpy ride.

Saiyaara box office prediction: Film records highest ticket sales since ChhaavaDirector Mohit Suri's 'Saiyaara' released in theatres on July 18, 2025. Recent advance booking reports suggest the Ahaan Panday-Aneet Padda starrer is set to have a Rs 25 crore opening at the box office.

Dipika Kakar set for TV comeback? In talks for new show with Vivian DsenaActor Dipika Kakar may return to television in a new show opposite Vivian Dsena, though nothing is confirmed yet. She recently spoke about wanting to work again after recovering from stage 2 liver cancer.

Saiyaara X reviews: Ahaan Pandey's debut gets a thumbs up for Aashiqui 2 vibesActor Ahaan Panday's debut 'Saiyaara' received accolades from fans. The movie's X reviews praised it for its music, cinematography, story and emotional depth.

Karan Tacker on Special Ops 2, Tanvi releasing togetherKaran Tacker celebrates a milestone with two simultaneous releases today. His roles in 'Special Ops 2' and 'Tanvi The Great' show his versatility, while he shares his feelings about this unique career moment.

Ram-Lakshman in one frame: Ravi Dubey, Ranbir Kapoor join Nitesh Tiwari for a momentRavi Dubey is living his best life as he gears up to play Lakshman in Nitesh Tiwari's 'Ramayana'. On Friday, he shared a photo with the director and his on-screen brother, Ranbir Kapoor.

Jennifer Lopez is done with marriage after split with Ben AffleckJennifer Lopez hinted she may be done with marriage after multiple attempts, including her recent divorce from Ben Affleck. Her response to a fan's proposal has sparked widespread discussion.

Nick Jonas opens up on how his father's cancer battle united the familySinger and actor Nick Jonas shared how his father's cancer battle in 2017 brought the Jonas family closer and made them stronger.

I Know What You Did Last Summer review: Gen Z-fication of slasher film is oddly funnyRelease Date:Fri Jul 18, 2025I Know What You Did Last Summer movie review: The 2025 reboot of 'I Know What You Did Last Summer' brings a Gen Z twist to the classic slasher. It mixes nostalgia with campy humour but falls short of being a genre-defining hit.

Vir Das Fool Volume review: Most experimental special yetRelease Date:Fri Jul 18, 2025Vir Das Fool Volume review: Vir Das returns with 'Fool Volume', his most experimental special yet, streaming on Netflix. The show blends diverse venues and tones, highlighting his mature comedic style and global outlook, says our review.

Kill Bill actor Michael Madsen's death linked to multiple health issues, alcoholismVeteran actor Michael Madsen died due to complications from cardiac arrest and chronic health issues. The latest reports revealed additional contributing factors, including coronary artery disease and chronic alcoholism.

Chris Hemsworth drums live with Ed Sheeran in Bucharest for new docuseries LimitlessChris Hemsworth took an unexpected leap from acting to drumming as he joined Ed Sheeran on stage before 70,000 fans in Bucharest. The clip resurfaced after the trailer for the docuseries 'Limitless: Live Better Now' released on Thursday.

Aanand L Rai slams re-release of Raanjhanaa with AI-powered climaxDirector Aanand L Rai has strongly opposed the AI-generated happy ending in the re-release of 'Raanjhanaa'. He stated that he was not informed or consulted by Eros International.

general news.headline: Masood Azhar seen in POK, 1,000 km away from Bahawalpur bastion: IntelJaish chief Masood Azhar is the mastermind of several terror activities in India, including the 2016 Pathankot airbase attack and the 2019 Pulwama attack.

2 months and counting: Pak runway struck during Op Sindoor remains under repairThe latest NOTAM issued by Pakistan says the runway at the Rahim Yar Khan air base will remain closed for flight operations till August 5.

Mystery of missing Russian woman, child, and a backdoor embassy entry in DelhiA Russian woman married to an Indian and their 4-year-old son have been missing since July 7 amid a custody battle. The woman, who is allegedly in a relationship with a diplomat, and the child, the husband told the Supreme Court, were last seen entering the Russian Embassy in New Delhi on July 4. The SC has sought a probe, and asked the embassy to cooperate.

It's a reminder that perhaps both heartbreak and healing can be beautiful.

What do we make of Bhagwat's retirement trial balloon?RSS sarsanghchalak Mohan Bhagwat's recent remarks advising public figures to step aside and 'retire' at the age of 75 have raised more than a few eyebrows. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will turn 75 in September, as will, ironically, Mohan Bhagwat.

Secret chambers, hidden exits: Mansion of conman arrested in Rs 500-crore scamMangaluru Police arrested Rohan Saldanha, accused of defrauding crores through fake loan schemes. His mansion, filled with secret rooms and luxury items, exposed the scale of his Rs 500 crore operation.

Missing Russian woman may have got outside help: Supreme Court on custody rowThe Russian woman and her child have been missing since July 7 amid a custody dispute. The Supreme Court hinted at possible collusion and directed police to expedite the investigation.

Why US branding 'Pahalgam' perpetrator TRF a global terror outfit is a message to PakistanThe Resistance Front (TRF), responsible for numerous terror strikes in Kashmir, is directed by the Pakistani military and intelligence, with its leadership and training pads based in Pakistan

Dr Ishan Shivanand breaks down what immortality really meansForget living forever in a physical sense. In his book, 'The Practice of Immortality', yogic teacher and researcher Dr. Ishan Shivanand explores how "real" immortality lies in emotional steadiness, breath control, and conscious awareness. On this episode of Booked, Dr. Shivanand joins Akshita Nandagopal.

Special Ops 2 review: Kay Kay Menon anchors ambitious but uneven spy thrillerRelease Date:Fri Jul 18, 2025Special Ops 2 series review: The second season of 'Special Ops' delves into AI-driven cyber warfare intertwined with classic spy drama. The season raises questions about technology's role in future conflicts and personal sacrifices.

When Urdu book on Prophet got publisher killed, earned India blasphemy lawA movie on Kanhaiya Lal Teli, a tailor in Udaipur who was beheaded by two Muslim men for sharing a post supporting a BJP leader's comments on Prophet Muhammad, is caught in a storm of controversy. In 1929, publisher Mahashe Rajpal was stabbed to death by a 19-year-old Muslim carpenter for the book Rangeela Rasool. Massive protests over the book resulted in the British introducing the blasphemy law in India.
Felix Baumgartner dead: Relive how he jumped from the edge of spaceJust hours before the accident, Baumgartner posted to Instagram about "too much wind," hinting at the challenging flying conditions.

Why AAP decided to dump INDIA blocAAP is now adopting the 'Ekla Cholo Re' strategy, inspired by Rabindranath Tagore's famous song that translates to 'walk alone if needed'. By walking alone once again, AAP aims to regain voters' trust, reinforce its core values, and revive the energy that once made it a powerful force in Indian politics.

Bouncers follow, beat up woman and her boyfriend after fight in Bengaluru barA 21-year-old woman has alleged that she and her two male friends were physically assaulted by bouncers during a visit to a popular resto-bar on Brigade Road in central Bengaluru. The bouncers were arrested and later released on bail.

No proof, report leaked: Details of Justice Varma's plea against burnt cash caseUnder fire over burnt cash allegations, Justice Yashwant Varma claimed the in-house probe lacked a formal complaint, seized no evidence, leaked findings to the media, and violated his constitutional rights.

Letter seeking Odisha victim's suspension emerges, friend says bid to silenceThe letter, accessed by India Today, was written on July 1 by a group of 71 students. The fresh revelations hint at a coordinated attempt to shield the accused professor.

Indian woman held for 7-hour shoplifting in Illinois; then a US visa warningAn Indian woman visiting the US was detained in Illinois for trying to steal goods worth over $1,300 from a store after spending 7 hours there. Even as a video from the May incident went viral, the US Embassy in India issued a stern warning to visa holders that involvement in crimes, including theft, could lead to visa-revocation.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
